header: Prophecy Against the King of Tyre

verse: The ·Lord spoke his word [word of the Lord came] to me, saying:
“·Human [Son of man; 2:1], say to the ruler of Tyre: ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“‘So this is what the Lord God says:
The ·Lord spoke his word [word of the Lord came] to me, saying:
“·Human [Son of man; 2:1], sing a ·funeral song [lament; dirge] for the king of Tyre. Say to him: ‘This is what the Lord God says:
The ·Lord spoke his word [word of the Lord came] to me, saying:
“·Human [Son of man; 2:1], ·look [set your face] toward the city of Sidon and prophesy against her.
Say: ‘This is what the Lord God says:

“‘No more will neighboring nations be like ·thorny branches [prickling briars] or sharp ·stickers [thorns] to ·hurt [treat with contempt/scorn the house of] Israel. Then they will know that I am the Lord God.

“‘This is what the Lord God says: I will gather the ·people [house] of Israel from the nations where they are scattered. I will show my holiness ·when the nations see what I do for my people [in them in the sight of the nations]. Then they will live in their own land—the land I gave to my servant Jacob.

They will live safely in the land and will build houses and plant vineyards. They will live in safety after I have ·punished [executed judgments against] all the nations around who ·hate them [treat them with contempt; scorn them]. Then they will know that I am the Lord their God.’”
